description: Newsham is the third station to open, with three more scheduled to be completed later in 2025.
title: Northumberland Line's Newsham Station to open on March 17
title_page: Northumberland Line's Newsham Station to open on March 17 - BBC News
maintext:
A date has been announced for the opening of a railway station on a new line.
Newsham, on the Northumberland Line, had been expected to open when passenger services between Ashington and Newcastle resumed in December, but was delayed.
It will now open on Monday 17 March, with tickets on sale from 10 March.
Northumberland County Council leader Glen Sanderson said: "Everyone involved with this project should feel incredibly proud to see another station opening."
Speaking in 2024, line programme delivery director Neil Blagburn described Newsham as the "biggest and most complex site" on the line.
It included the construction of a £30m road bridge over the line, which opened in August 2024.
Its construction costs were estimated to be just more than £11m in 2021 before spiralling, with inflation blamed for the rise.
The station's original signal box was found to be structurally unsound and was also demolished.
